---
description: Instructions for technical articles and guides
applyTo: 'tech/**/*.md'
---

# Technical Content Instructions

## Technical Accuracy
- Verify all <mark>technical claims</mark> against official documentation
- Test or verify <mark>all code examples</mark> before including them
- <mark>Specify versions</mark> for frameworks, libraries, and tools
- Include prerequisites and dependencies
- Note platform-specific considerations (Windows, macOS, Linux)

## Code Examples
- Include complete, runnable examples when possible
- Add comments explaining non-obvious logic
- Show both correct usage and common pitfalls
- Include error handling examples
- Provide links to full example repositories when relevant

## Technical Depth
- Define technical terms on first use
- Link to authoritative references for deeper dives
- Balance detail with readability
- Include diagrams for complex architectures
- Provide multiple examples showing different use cases

## Version Control
- Specify applicable versions prominently
- Note deprecated features or approaches
- Include migration guides when APIs change
- Link to official changelogs or release notes

## Security Considerations
- Highlight security implications
- Never include real credentials or secrets in examples
- Use placeholder values clearly marked as examples
- Reference security best practices documentation
